title: Quentin Tarantino to show two different versions of 'Hateful Eight'
text:
Samuel L. Jackson stars in "The Hateful Eight." (Photo: Andrew Cooper, The Weinstein Co.)
5 CONNECT 18 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Quentin Tarantino is bringing back the roadshow — but not just for nostalgia.
The two-time Oscar-winner's upcoming Hateful Eight will be cut in two versions: A shorter theatrical release and an Ultra Panavision 70mm roadshow release that is 12 minutes longer.
“The roadshow version has an overture and an intermission, and it will be three hours, two minutes,” Tarantino said to Variety .
Certain scenes will be tweaked in the limited roadshow version to give a different experience than the theatrical version, Tarantino told Variety . The scenes will play in “big, long, cool, unblinking takes” to further take advantage of the scope of a 70mm projection, Tarantino said.
USA TODAY
'Hateful Eight' gets special Christmas release
The Weinstein Co. is planning to install roadshow projectors in 100 theaters across the country. Previous films that were released in a 70mm print, such as Interstellar and The Master , only made 12 and 16 prints, respectively.
But that doesn't mean that folks who are seeing the multiplex version will be getting shortchanged. The scenes are slightly altered in the theatrical cut to make it easier to view in both the theater and on TV.
The 70 is the 70,” Tarantino said. “You’ve paid the money. You’ve bought your ticket. So you’re there. I’ve got you. But I actually changed the cutting slightly for a couple of the multiplex scenes because it’s not that. Now it’s on Showtime Extreme. You’re watching it on TV and you just kind of want to watch a movie on your couch. Or you’re at Hot Dog on a Stick and you just want to catch a movie."
Hateful Eight will be released in theaters Dec. 25, 2015.
